TEXT.English: [TAB]The Wright Brothers corrected earlier mistakes in calculations regarding drag and lift, though they missed the effect of Reynolds number (known since 1883), which would have given them an even bigger advantage. Their testing and calculating produced a third glider design, which they flew in 1902. It performed far better than the previous models. In the end, by establishing their rigorous system of designing, wind-tunnel testing of models and flight testing of full-size prototypes, the Wrights not only built a working aircraft but also helped advance the modern science of aeronautical engineering.
TEXT.French: [TAB]The Wright Brothers corrected earlier mistakes in calculations regarding drag and lift, though they missed the effect of Reynolds number (known since 1883), which would have given them an even bigger advantage. Their testing and calculating produced a third glider design, which they flew in 1902. It performed far better than the previous models. In the end, by establishing their rigorous system of designing, wind-tunnel testing of models and flight testing of full-size prototypes, the Wrights not only built a working aircraft but also helped advance the modern science of aeronautical engineering.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Gebrüder Wright behoben frühe Fehler in den Berechnungen bezüglich Ströhmung und Auftrieb, obwohl sie dabei den Reynolds Effekt (bekannt seit 1883) unberücksichtigt ließen, was deren Arbeit nocheinmal deutlich verbessert hätte. Ihre Berechnungen und Versuche führten zu einem dritten Gleiterdesign, das sie 1902 flogen mit deutlich besseren Ergebnissen als mit Vormodellen. Schließlich, indem sie ihr System des Entwerfens, der Windkanäl-Versuche und der Erprobung von Prototypen in voller Größe umsetzten, bauten die Wrights nicht nur voll funktionstüchtige Flugzeuge, sondern halfen auch die Theorie der modernen Luftfahrt weiter zu entwickeln.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Multiple expansion engines use either three or four expansion stages and are known as triple and quadruple expansion engines respectively. These engines use a series of double-acting cylinders of progressively increasing diameter and/or stroke and hence volume. These cylinders are designed to divide the work into three or four, as appropriate, equal portions for each expansion stage. As with the double expansion engine, where space is at a premium, two smaller cylinders of a large sum volume may be used for the low pressure stage. Multiple expansion engines typically had the cylinders arranged inline, but various other formations were used.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Multiple expansion engines use either three or four expansion stages and are known as triple and quadruple expansion engines respectively. These engines use a series of double-acting cylinders of progressively increasing diameter and/or stroke and hence volume. These cylinders are designed to divide the work into three or four, as appropriate, equal portions for each expansion stage. As with the double expansion engine, where space is at a premium, two smaller cylinders of a large sum volume may be used for the low pressure stage. Multiple expansion engines typically had the cylinders arranged inline, but various other formations were used.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Mehrfachexpansionsantriebe benutzen drei oder vier Expansionsstufen, die dann als Drei- oder Vierfachexpansionsantriebe bezeichnet werden. Diese Antriebe benutzen eine Reihe zweifachwirkender Zylinder mit stufenweise zunehmendem Durchmesser und/oder Hub und damit zunehmendem Volumen. Diese Zylinder sind so entworfen, dass sie die zu verrichtende Arbeit entsprechend in drei oder vier gleiche Teile für die einzelnen Expansionsstufen zerlegen. Entsprechend gibt es platzsparende Zweifachexpansionsantriebe. Mehrfachexpansionsantriebe haben die Zylinder für gewöhnlich in einer Linie angeordnet, doch es gibt auch abweichende Anordnungen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]I motori ad espansione multipla usano tre o quattro tempi di espansione e sono quindi conosciuti come motori a tripla o quadrupla espansione rispettivamente. Questi motori usano una serie di cilindri a due tempi di diametro e/o corsa e volume progressivamente più grandi. Questi cilindri sono disegnati per dividere il lavoro in tre o quattro partizioni, in base all'uso, uguali per ogni fase di espansione. Così come il motore ad espansione doppia, dove è privilegiato lo spazio, due cilindri più piccoli con un ampio volume complessivo possono essere usati per le fasi a bassa pressione. I motori ad espansione multipla tipicamente hanno i cilindri in linea, ma sono state usate anche varie altre soluzioni.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Multiple expansion engines use either three or four expansion stages and are known as triple and quadruple expansion engines respectively. These engines use a series of double-acting cylinders of progressively increasing diameter and/or stroke and hence volume. These cylinders are designed to divide the work into three or four, as appropriate, equal portions for each expansion stage. As with the double expansion engine, where space is at a premium, two smaller cylinders of a large sum volume may be used for the low pressure stage. Multiple expansion engines typically had the cylinders arranged inline, but various other formations were used.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A Diesel engine is an internal combustion engine which operates using the Diesel cycle. German engineer Rudolf Diesel invented it in 1892, basing it on the hot bulb engine. He received a patent for it on February 23, 1893. The Diesel cycle uses compression ignition: the fuel ignites upon being injected into the highly compressed air in the combustion chamber. By contrast, petrol engines utilize the Otto cycle, in which fuel and air are typically mixed before entering the combustion chamber. The mixture is then ignited by a spark plug. Compression ignition is generally considered undesirable in Otto cycle engines (see engine knocking).
TEXT.French: [TAB]A Diesel engine is an internal combustion engine which operates using the Diesel cycle. German engineer Rudolf Diesel invented it in 1892, basing it on the hot bulb engine. He received a patent for it on February 23, 1893. The Diesel cycle uses compression ignition: the fuel ignites upon being injected into the highly compressed air in the combustion chamber. By contrast, petrol engines utilize the Otto cycle, in which fuel and air are typically mixed before entering the combustion chamber. The mixture is then ignited by a spark plug. Compression ignition is generally considered undesirable in Otto cycle engines (see engine knocking).
TEXT.German: [TAB]Ein Dieselmotor ist ein interner Verbrennungsmotor, der Dieselzylinder benutzt. Der deutsche Ingenieur Rudolf Diesel entwickelte ihn 1892 basierend auf dem Glühkopfmotor. Das Patent wurde ihm am 23. Februar 1893 erteilt. Der Dieselmotor nutzt eine komprimierte Zündung: Der Treibstoff wird in die hochverdichtete Luft in der Zündkammer eingespritzt. (Im Gegensatz zu Ottomotoren, wo erst ein Luft-Treibstoff-Gemisch erzeugt wird, das dann in die Verbrennungskammer geleitet wird.) Die Mischung wird dann durch einen Glühkopf entzündet. Mein Ottomotoren wiederrum ist eine komprimierte Zündung unerwünscht (Klopfen).

Compression ignition is generally considered undesirable in Otto cycle engines (see engine knocking).

TEXT.English: [TAB]Prototyping is the process of quickly putting together a working model (a prototype) in order to test various aspects of a design, illustrate ideas or features and gather early user feedback. Prototyping is often treated as an integral part of the system design process, where it is believed to reduce project risk and cost. When the prototype is sufficiently refined and meets the functionality, robustness, manufacturability and other design goals, the product is ready for production.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Prototyping is the process of quickly putting together a working model (a prototype) in order to test various aspects of a design, illustrate ideas or features and gather early user feedback. Prototyping is often treated as an integral part of the system design process, where it is believed to reduce project risk and cost. When the prototype is sufficiently refined and meets the functionality, robustness, manufacturability and other design goals, the product is ready for production.
TEXT.German: [Tab] Musterentwicklung ist der Prozess, bei dem möglichst schnell ein funktionierendes Modell (ein Prototyp) erstellt wird, um damit die verschiedenen Aspekte des Designs zu untersuchen, Ideen zu illustrieren und frühe Rückschlüsse zu erzielen. Die Musterentwicklung ist oft ein wesendlicher Bestandteil der Entwicklung, wann immer es vorraussichtlich Kosten und Risiko spart. When ein Prototyp die Anforderungen an Funktionalität, Stabilität, leichter Herstellbarkeit und anderer Ziele erfüllt, ist das Produkt für die Massenfertigung bereit.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Sloped armour is armour that is mounted at a non-vertical and non-horizontal angle, typically on tanks and other armoured fighting vehicles. For a given normal to the surface of the armour, its plate thickness, increasing armour slope improves the armour's level of protection by increasing the thickness measured on a horizontal plane, while for a given area density of the armour the protection can be either increased or reduced by other sloping effects, depending on the armour materials used and the qualities of the projectile hitting it. The increased protection caused by increasing the slope while keeping the plate thickness constant, is due to a proportional increase of area density and thus mass, and thus offers no weight benefit. Therefore the other possible effects of sloping, such as deflection, deforming and ricochet of a projectile, have been the reasons to apply sloped armour in armoured vehicles design.

The increased protection caused by increasing the slope while keeping the plate thickness constant, is due to a proportional increase of area density and thus mass, and thus offers no weight benefit. Therefore the other possible effects of sloping, such as deflection, deforming and ricochet of a projectile, have been the reasons to apply sloped armour in armoured vehicles design.

TEXT.English: Research into the effects of sloping armour plate was first conducted in the 1930s by the French SOMUA, and by the Soviet tank design team of the Kharkov Locomotive Factory. It was a technological response to the more effective anti-tank guns being put into service at this time.

TEXT.German: Forschungen im Bereich der Abgeschrägten Panzerung wurden zuerst in den 1930ern durch die fränzösische SOMUA und durch das sowjetische Panzerentwicklungsteam der Kharkov Fahrzeugwerke betrieben. Es war die technologische Antwort auf die immer besseren Anti-Panzer-Waffen dieser Zeit.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A jet engine is an engine that discharges a fast moving jet of fluid to generate thrust in accordance with Newton's third law of motion. This broad definition of jet engines includes turbojets, turbofans, rockets, ramjets, pulse jets and pump-jets, but in common usage, the term generally refers to a gas turbine Brayton cycle engine, an engine with a rotary compressor powered by a turbine, with the leftover power providing thrust. Jet engines are so familiar to the modern world that gas turbines are sometimes mistakenly referred to as a particular application of a jet engine, rather than the other way around. Most jet engines are internal combustion engines but non combusting forms exist also.
TEXT.French: [TAB]A jet engine is an engine that discharges a fast moving jet of fluid to generate thrust in accordance with Newton's third law of motion. This broad definition of jet engines includes turbojets, turbofans, rockets, ramjets, pulse jets and pump-jets, but in common usage, the term generally refers to a gas turbine Brayton cycle engine, an engine with a rotary compressor powered by a turbine, with the leftover power providing thrust. Jet engines are so familiar to the modern world that gas turbines are sometimes mistakenly referred to as a particular application of a jet engine, rather than the other way around. Most jet engines are internal combustion engines but non combusting forms exist also.
TEXT.German: [TAB] Ein Strahltriebwerk ist ein Antrieb, der nach hinten einen hochbeschleunigten Flüssigkeitsstrahl ausstößt, um dadurch nach dem dritten Newton'schen Bewegungsgesetz einen Vorwärtsantrieb zu erzeugen. Diese grobe Umschreibung beinhaltet verschiedere Triebwerke wie Turbojets, Turbofans, Raketen, Ramjets, Puls- und Pumpjets. Jedoch für gewöhnlich meint dieser Ausdruck ein Brayton-Triebwerk mit Gasturbine, einem Antrieb mit einem rotierendem Kompressor angetrieben durch eine Turbine. Strahltriebwerke sind in der modernen Welt so alltäglich, dass Gasturbinen teilweise irrtümlich als Anwendung von Strahltriebwerken bezeichnet werden, statt umgekehrt. Die meisten Strahltriebwerke arbeiten mit einer internen Verbrennung, doch es gibt auch welche ganz ohne Verbrennung.

Jet engines are so familiar to the modern world that gas turbines are sometimes mistakenly referred to as a particular application of a jet engine, rather than the other way around. Most jet engines are internal combustion engines but non combusting forms exist also.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Supersonic aerodynamics are simpler than subsonic because the airsheets at different points along the plane often can't affect each other. Supersonic jets and rocket vehicles require several times greater thrust to push through the extra drag experienced within the transonic region (around Mach 0.85-1.5). At these speeds Aerospace engineers can gently guide air around the fuselage of the aircraft without producing new shock waves but any change in cross sectional area further down the vehicle leads to shock waves along the body. Designers use the Supersonic area rule and the Whitcomb area rule to minimize sudden changes in size.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Supersonic aerodynamics are simpler than subsonic because the airsheets at different points along the plane often can't affect each other. Supersonic jets and rocket vehicles require several times greater thrust to push through the extra drag experienced within the transonic region (around Mach 0.85-1.5). At these speeds Aerospace engineers can gently guide air around the fuselage of the aircraft without producing new shock waves but any change in cross sectional area further down the vehicle leads to shock waves along the body. Designers use the Supersonic area rule and the Whitcomb area rule to minimize sudden changes in size.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Überschallflug ist in gewisser Weise einfacher als Unterschallflug, weil die Luftschichten an verschiedenen Stellen des Flugzeugs sich nicht beeinflussen können. Überschall-Düsenjäger und Raketen benötigen um einiges größeren Schub, um zunächst die sogenannte Schallmauer zu durchbrechnen (etwa zwischen Mach 0,85 und 1,5). Bei dieser Geschwindigkeit können Luftfahrtingenieure die Luft sanft um Flugzeugrumpf leiten, ohne neue Schockwellen zu erzeugen. Allerdings bewegt sich eine konstante Schockwelle entlang der Flugrichtung unterhalb und mit der Maschine.

TEXT.English: It should be kept in mind, however, that the aerodynamic principles behind a supersonic aircraft are often more complex due to the fact that such an aircraft must be efficient and stable at supersonic, transonic and subsonic flight.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A military armoured car is a type of armored fighting vehicle having wheels (from four to ten large off-road wheels) instead of tracks, and usually light armor. Armored cars are typically less expensive and have superior speed and range compared to tracked military vehicles. Most are not intended for heavy fighting; their normal use is for reconnaissance, command, control, and communications, or for use against lightly armed insurgents or rioters. Only some are intended to enter close combat, often accompanying convoys to protect soft-skinned vehicles. They usually mount a machine gun, autocannon, or small tank gun. Other uses include as a way to move (or tow) various long-range rocket, missile, or mortar batteries through dangerous areas while giving some protection to the crew.
TEXT.French: [TAB]A military armoured car is a type of armored fighting vehicle having wheels (from four to ten large off-road wheels) instead of tracks, and usually light armor. Armored cars are typically less expensive and have superior speed and range compared to tracked military vehicles. Most are not intended for heavy fighting; their normal use is for reconnaissance, command, control, and communications, or for use against lightly armed insurgents or rioters. Only some are intended to enter close combat, often accompanying convoys to protect soft-skinned vehicles. They usually mount a machine gun, autocannon, or small tank gun. Other uses include as a way to move (or tow) various long-range rocket, missile, or mortar batteries through dangerous areas while giving some protection to the crew.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Ein militärischer Panzerwagen ist ein Kampffahrzeug mit vier bis zehn Rädern statt Kettenantrieb und leichter Panzerung. Panzerwagen sind für gewöhnlich günstiger, schnellerund haben bessere Einsatzreichweite als Kettenfahrzeuge. Die meisten sind nicht für schwere Kampfhandlungen ausgelegt; Ihr normaler Einsatz besteht aus Aufklärung, Koordination und Kommunikation oder natürlich gegen andere leicht gepanzerte Gegner oder Aufständische. Nur wenige sind für den offenen Kampf tauglich, oft für den Konvoidienst eingeteilt. Die übliche Bewaffnung besteht aus einem Maschinengewehr, einem leichtem Geschütz oder manchmal aus Trägern für Raketen oder Mörsern..

TEXT.English: [TAB]Light tanks tend to be smaller, faster, and lighter vehicles, and cheaper to produce. The weight of a 'light' tank increased markedly during WWII. For example, the M24 Chaffee was a purpose-built light tank of late WWII, but weighed more than the Panzer III, a mainstay medium tank from 1939-43 but obsolete at the time the Chaffee was introduced. Some light tanks are able to move over land rapidly compared to heavier tanks and are maneuverable through obstacles such as jungle thickets, while maintaining lethality against enemy infantry. The Imperial Japanese Army exploited this ability of their light tanks during the Battle of Malaya. However, many other light tanks are no more mobile than their heavier cousins, in part because the emphasis on economy meant they often were powered by standard light truck engines rather than the larger, heavier, but much more powerful medium tank engines.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Light tanks tend to be smaller, faster, and lighter vehicles, and cheaper to produce. The weight of a 'light' tank increased markedly during WWII. For example, the M24 Chaffee was a purpose-built light tank of late WWII, but weighed more than the Panzer III, a mainstay medium tank from 1939-43 but obsolete at the time the Chaffee was introduced. Some light tanks are able to move over land rapidly compared to heavier tanks and are maneuverable through obstacles such as jungle thickets, while maintaining lethality against enemy infantry. The Imperial Japanese Army exploited this ability of their light tanks during the Battle of Malaya. However, many other light tanks are no more mobile than their heavier cousins, in part because the emphasis on economy meant they often were powered by standard light truck engines rather than the larger, heavier, but much more powerful medium tank engines.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Leichter Panzer sind kleiner, schneller, leichter und kostengünstiger. Das Gewicht 'Leichter' Panzer erhöhter sich merklich während des Zweiten Weltkrieges. Zum Beispiel war der M24 Chaffee ein speziel gebauter Leichter Panzer des Zweiten Weltkrieges, wog jedoch mehr als der Panzer III, einem bedeutenden Mittleren Panzer von 1939-43, der jedoch schon überhohlt war, als der Chaffee eingeführt wurde. Einige Leichte Panzer sind vergleichbar schnell im Gelände, verglichen mit schwereren Fahrzeugen, und können Hindernisse zum Beispiel im Dschungel umfahren, während sie immernoch gefährlich gegen Infantrie sind. Die japanische Armee entdeckte diese Eigenschaft ihrer Leichten Panzer während der Schlacht um Malaya. Für andere Leichte Panzer hingegen gilt dies nicht, da sie aufgrund von Sparmaßnahmen nur mit schweren LKW-Motoren ausgestattet wurden, statt mit größeren, schweren aber stärkeren Maschinen eines Mittleren Panzers.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Heavy tanks have usually been deployed to fulfill the need for a breakthrough tank, though in practice have been more useful in the defensive role than in the attack. Design goals have included attacking obstacles, creating breakthroughs, and engaging enemy armoured formations. They feature very heavy armour and weapons relative to lighter tanks, though they tend to push power plants to the limits. As a result they tend to be either underpowered and comparatively slow, or have engine and drive train problems from overworking their engines.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Heavy tanks have usually been deployed to fulfill the need for a breakthrough tank, though in practice have been more useful in the defensive role than in the attack. Design goals have included attacking obstacles, creating breakthroughs, and engaging enemy armoured formations. They feature very heavy armour and weapons relative to lighter tanks, though they tend to push power plants to the limits. As a result they tend to be either underpowered and comparatively slow, or have engine and drive train problems from overworking their engines.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Schwere Panzer wurden für ursprünglich geplant, um die feindlichen Linien zu durchbrechen. In der Praxis jedoch zeigten sie sich brauchbarer im defensivem statt im offensivem Einsatz. Einsatzziele beinhalteten das Durchbrechen von Hindernissen und feindlicher Panzerformationen. Verglichen mit leichteren Panzern verfügen sie über sehr schwere Panzerung und Waffensysteme, während sie dazu neigen, die Antriebssysteme beinahe zu überlasten. Entsprechend langsam und schwerfällig wirken sie im Einsatz.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Advances in tank design, armour, and engine technology allowed tank designers to increase the capabilities of tanks significantly without always resorting to heavier designs, although weights did gradually increase. Many Cold War MBTs evolved more or less directly from late WWII medium tank designs: the US Patton series of tanks was a series of successive evolutions of the M26 Pershing, for example, and the Russian T54/55 was a direct descendant of the T-44, itself an evolution of the T-34. This means than many MBTs retained something of their "medium tank" origins in terms of their balance size, weight, mobility, and protection.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Advances in tank design, armour, and engine technology allowed tank designers to increase the capabilities of tanks significantly without always resorting to heavier designs, although weights did gradually increase. Many Cold War MBTs evolved more or less directly from late WWII medium tank designs: the US Patton series of tanks was a series of successive evolutions of the M26 Pershing, for example, and the Russian T54/55 was a direct descendant of the T-44, itself an evolution of the T-34. This means than many MBTs retained something of their "medium tank" origins in terms of their balance size, weight, mobility, and protection.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Fortschritte in der Panzerentwicklung, in Panzerung selbst und in der Antriebstechnik erhöhten die Möglichkeiten von Panzern deutlich, ohne ständig immer schwerfälligere Fahrzeuge entwerfen zu müssen. Viele Kampfpanzer des Kalten Krieges wurden mehr oder weniger direkt von Mittleren Panzern des Zweiten Weltkrieges entwickelt: Die US Patton Serie zum Beispiel wurde aus dem M26 Pershing entwickelt, und der russische T54/55 direkt aus dem T-44, der wiederrum Nachfolger des T-34 war. Entsprechend haben viele Kampfpanzer Ähnlichkeit mit deren Ursprüngen als Mittlere Panzer.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Advances in tank design, armour, and engine technology allowed tank designers to increase the capabilities of tanks significantly without always resorting to heavier designs, although weights did gradually increase. Many Cold War MBTs evolved more or less directly from late WWII medium tank designs: the US Patton series of tanks was a series of successive evolutions of the M26 Pershing, for example, and the Russian T54/55 was a direct descendant of the T-44, itself an evolution of the T-34. This means than many MBTs retained something of their "medium tank" origins in terms of their balance size, weight, mobility, and protection.

TEXT.English: [TAB]An assault gun is a gun or howitzer mounted on a motor vehicle or armored chassis, designed for use in the direct fire role in support of infantry when attacking other infantry or fortified positions. Historically the custom-built fully armored assault guns usually mounted the gun or howitzer in a fully enclosed casemate on a tank chassis. The use of a casemate instead of a gun turret limited these weapons' field of fire, but provided a simpler construction that was cheaper to build and less prone to mechanical breakdowns. The increased space and reduced weight of the turretless design also allowed mounting a larger weapon and providing heavier frontal armour on any given chassis, and in most cases these turretless vehicles also presented a lower profile as a target for the enemy.

The increased space and reduced weight of the turretless design also allowed mounting a larger weapon and providing heavier frontal armour on any given chassis, and in most cases these turretless vehicles also presented a lower profile as a target for the enemy.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Sturmgeschütze sind Geschütze oder Haubitzen, die auf motorisierten Fahrzeugen oder gepanzerten Fahrgestellen montiert werden, entworfen um Infanterie Deckung zu geben, beim Angriff auf andere Infanterie oder befestigte Positionen. Historisch wurden Sturmgeschütze oft in komplett geschlossene Kasematten oder auf Panzer-Chassis gebaut. Der Einsatz einer Kasematte statt eines beweglichen Turms begrenzt zwar den Feuerbereich der Waffe, stellt jedoch ein günstigeres und weniger anfälliges Konstrukt dar. Durch verringertes Gewicht und Platzbedarf eines turmlosen Entwurfs ermöglicht ebenso die Montage einer deutlich größeren Waffe und schwerer Frontpanzerung auf einem vergleichbarem Fahrgestell. Ebenso bieten sie im Profil weniger Angriffsfläche.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Ironclads were designed for several roles, including as high seas battleships, coastal defence ships, and long-range cruisers. The rapid evolution of warship design in the late 19th century transformed the ironclad from a wooden-hulled vessel which carried sails to supplement its steam engines into the steel-built, turreted battleships and cruisers familiar in the 20th century. This change was pushed forward by the development of heavier naval guns (the ironclads of the 1880s carried some of the heaviest guns ever mounted at sea), more sophisticated steam engines, and advances in metallurgy which made steel shipbuilding possible.

The rapid evolution of warship design in the late 19th century transformed the ironclad from a wooden-hulled vessel which carried sails to supplement its steam engines into the steel-built, turreted battleships and cruisers familiar in the 20th century. This change was pushed forward by the development of heavier naval guns (the ironclads of the 1880s carried some of the heaviest guns ever mounted at sea), more sophisticated steam engines, and advances in metallurgy which made steel shipbuilding possible.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Panzerschiffe wurden für verschiedene Einsatzzwecke entworfen, unter anderem als Hochseeschlachtschiffe, Küstenverteidigung und Langstreckenkreuzer. Die schnelle Entwicklung der Kriegsschiffe im späten 19. Jahrhundert verwandelten das Panzerschiff von einem einem Fahrzeug mit Holzrumpf und Segeln in ein dampfgetriebenes, aus Stahl gebautes undmit Türmen versehendes Kriegsschiff, das Ähnlichkeiten mit Kreuzern des 20. Jahrhunderts hatte. Dieser Wandel wurde vorrangetrieben durch die Entwicklung schwerer Seegeschütze, besserer Dampfmaschinen und besserer Metallurgie, die die Konstruktion von Stahlschiffen ermöglichte.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The dreadnought was the predominant type of battleship of the 20th century. Modelled after the revolutionary HMS Dreadnought of 1906, dreadnoughts were distinguished from previous battleships, known as pre-dreadnoughts, by an 'all-big-gun' armament. Within a few years of HMS Dreadnought's launch, all navies were building ships inspired by her design. The product of British technical superiority and the willpower of Admiral Jackie Fisher, Dreadnought was no bolt from the blue. The concept of an all-big-gun ship had been in circulation for several years, and the Japanese had even laid down an all-big-gun battleship in 1904. The arrival of the Dreadnoughts sparked a new arms race, principally between Britain and Germany but reflected worldwide, as the new class of warships became a crucial symbol of national power.
TEXT.French: [TAB]The dreadnought was the predominant type of battleship of the 20th century. Modelled after the revolutionary HMS Dreadnought of 1906, dreadnoughts were distinguished from previous battleships, known as pre-dreadnoughts, by an 'all-big-gun' armament. Within a few years of HMS Dreadnought's launch, all navies were building ships inspired by her design. The product of British technical superiority and the willpower of Admiral Jackie Fisher, Dreadnought was no bolt from the blue. The concept of an all-big-gun ship had been in circulation for several years, and the Japanese had even laid down an all-big-gun battleship in 1904. The arrival of the Dreadnoughts sparked a new arms race, principally between Britain and Germany but reflected worldwide, as the new class of warships became a crucial symbol of national power.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Dreadnought war im 20. Jahrhundert die überlegene Schlachtschiffklasse. Das Modell entwickelte sich aus der revolutionären HMS Dreadnought von 1906 und unterschied sich von vorherigen Schlachtschiffen, bekannt als Prä-Dreadnoughts, durch ihre Bewaffnung aus großen Geschützen. Wenige Jahre nach der Indienststellung der HMS Dreadnought, bauten bereits sehr viele Flotten Schiffe, die durch ihr Design inspiriert waren. Das Produkt technischer Überlegenheit der Britten und der Willenskraft von Admiral Jackie Fisher kam nicht aus heiterem Himmel. Das Konzept eines Schiffes mit derart schwerer Bewaffnung ging bereits seit einigen Jahren um, und die Japaner bauten bereits 1904 eins. Das Auftauchen der Dreadnoughts verursachte ein Wettrüsten, vor allem zwischen Großbritanien und Deutschland, jedoch mit weltweiten Einflüssen, und diese neue Schiffsklasse wurde zum Statussymbol der Macht vieler Nationen. (A.d.Ü.: Das Wort "dreadnought" wird im Deutschen normalerweise genauso wie "battleship" mit "Schlachtschiff" übersetzt. Um eine Unterscheidung zu ermöglichen, wird "Dreadnought" nicht übersetzt.)

TEXT.English: [TAB]A pre-dreadnought battleship is an ocean-going battleship of a type built between the mid-1890s and 1905. Pre-dreadnoughts replaced the ironclad battleship of the 1870s and 1880s. Built from steel, and protected by hardened steel armour, pre-dreadnought battleships carried a main battery of very heavy guns in turrets supported by one or more secondary batteries of lighter weapons. They were propelled by coal-powered triple-expansion steam engines. In the 1890s, navies worldwide started to build battleships to a common designin contrast to the chaotic development of ironclad warships in preceding decades, dozens of ships worldwide essentially followed the design of the British Majestic. The similar appearance of the battleships of the 1890s was underlined by the increasing number of ships being built. New naval powers like Germany, Japan and the USA began to establish themselves with fleets of pre-dreadnought battleships, while the navies of Britain, France and Russia expanded to meet the threat. The main clashes of pre-dreadnought fleets came during the Russo-Japanese War of 19045.
TEXT.French: [TAB]A pre-dreadnought battleship is an ocean-going battleship of a type built between the mid-1890s and 1905. Pre-dreadnoughts replaced the ironclad battleship of the 1870s and 1880s. Built from steel, and protected by hardened steel armour, pre-dreadnought battleships carried a main battery of very heavy guns in turrets supported by one or more secondary batteries of lighter weapons. They were propelled by coal-powered triple-expansion steam engines. In the 1890s, navies worldwide started to build battleships to a common designin contrast to the chaotic development of ironclad warships in preceding decades, dozens of ships worldwide essentially followed the design of the British Majestic. The similar appearance of the battleships of the 1890s was underlined by the increasing number of ships being built. New naval powers like Germany, Japan and the USA began to establish themselves with fleets of pre-dreadnought battleships, while the navies of Britain, France and Russia expanded to meet the threat. The main clashes of pre-dreadnought fleets came during the Russo-Japanese War of 19045.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Ein Prä-Dreadnought Schlachtschiff ist ein seetüchtiges Schlachtschiff, wie es zwischen 1890 und 1905 gebaut wurde. Prä-Dreadnoughts ersetzten die gepanzerten Schlachtschiffe der 1870er und 80er. Mit einem Rumpf und einer Panzerung aus Stahl trugen Prä-Dreadnought Schlachtschiffe eine Hauptbatterie aus schweren Geschützen in Türmen unterstützt aus einer oder mehreres sekundären Batterien mit leichteren Geschützen. Sie wurden durch Kohlegetrieben Dreifachexpansions-Dampfmotoren angetrieben. In den 1890ern begannen Flotten weltweit Schlachtschiffe einheitlich zu bauen im Gegensatz zu dem Durcheinander an Entwürfen bei Panzerschiffen zuvor. So wurden zum Beispiel Dutzende Schiffe weltweit der brittischen Majestic nachempfunden. Die Ähnlichkeit im Aussehen von Schlachtschiffen in den 1890ern wurde durch die gestiegene Produktionszahl unterstrichen. Aufstrebende Seemächte wie Deutschland, Japan und die USA etablierten sich durch Flotten aus Prä-Dreadnoughts, während die Flotten Großbritaniens, Frankreichs und Rußland expandierten, um dieser Bedrohung zu begegnen. Die größten Kampfhandlungen zwischen Prä-Dreadnoughts gab es im Krieg zwischen Rußland und Japan 1904-05. (A.d.Ü.: Der Prä-Dreadnought ist eigentlich auch ein Schlachtschiff älteren Designs.)

TEXT.English: [TAB]The emergence of the destroyer, and development up until WWII, was related to the torpedo. The invention of the self-propelled torpedo in the 1860's gave the potential for a nation to destroy a superior enemy battle fleet using only steam launches from which torpedoes could be dropped. Fast boats to carry torpedoes were built and called torpedo boats, and these had developed by the 1880's into little ships of 50-100 tons, fast enough to evade enemy picket boats.
TEXT.French: [TAB]The emergence of the destroyer, and development up until WWII, was related to the torpedo. The invention of the self-propelled torpedo in the 1860's gave the potential for a nation to destroy a superior enemy battle fleet using only steam launches from which torpedoes could be dropped. Fast boats to carry torpedoes were built and called torpedo boats, and these had developed by the 1880's into little ships of 50-100 tons, fast enough to evade enemy picket boats.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Das Aufkommen der Zerstörer und deren Entwicklung bis zum Zweiten Weltkrieg stand im Zusammenhang mit dem Torpedo. Die Erfindung selbstangetriebener Torpedos in den 1860ern ermöglichte es Nationen überlegene Feindflotten zu vernichten, nur indem sie dampfgetrieben Torpedorohre einsetzten. Schnelle Boote mit Torpedos (Torpedoboote) wurden gebaut, was in den 1880ern zur Entwicklung kleiner Schiffe mit 50 bis 100 Tonnen führte, die shcnell genug waren feindlichen Wachschiffen auszuweichen.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Protected cruisers were a type of naval cruiser of the late 19th century. They were so known because their armour protected their vital machine spaces. They were less well protected than armoured cruisers which also had a belt of armour along the sides. While the armoured cruiser evolved into the battlecruiser (and while pre-dreadnought battleships were replaced by dreadnoughts), the protected cruiser is considered the forerunner of the light cruiser and heavy cruiser types.

TEXT.German: [TAB]Geschützte Kreuzer waren ein Kreuzertyp des späten 19. Jahrhunderts. Sie wurden durch die spezielle Panzerung bekannt, die wichtige Maschinenbereiche schützte. Gleichzeitig waren sie weniger geschützt als Gepanzerte Kreuzer, die auch seitlich Zusatzpanzerung trugen. Während sich die Gepanzerten Kreuzer zu Schlachtkreuzer entwickelten, waren die Geschützten Kreuzer die Vorläufer der Leichten und Schweren Kreuzer.

TEXT.English: [TAB]An aircraft carrier is a warship designed to deploy and in most cases recover aircraft, acting as a sea-going airbase. Aircraft carriers thus allow a naval force to project air power great distances without having to depend on local bases for staging aircraft operations. They have evolved from wooden vessels used to deploy a balloon into nuclear powered warships that carry dozens of fixed and rotary wing aircraft.

TEXT.German: [TAB]Flugzeugträger sind Kriegsschiffe, die dafür gebaut sind, Flugzeuge wie schwimmende Flughäfen abzusetzen und meistens auch wieder aufzunehmen. Daher erlauben Flügzeugträger einer Seemacht Luftwaffe einzusetzen, ohne von günstig gelegenen Flugfeldern abhängig zu sein. Sie entwickelten sich von hölzernen Schiffen, die Ballons absetzten, zu atomgetriebenen Kriegsschiffen, die Dutzende Flugzeuge tragen können.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The word fighter was first used to describe a two seater aircraft, with sufficient lift to carry a machine gun and its operator as well as the pilot. The first such fighters belonged to the gunbus series of experimental gun carriers of the Vickers company which culminated in the Vickers F.B.5 Gunbus of 1914. The main drawback of this type of aircraft was its lack of speed. It was quickly realised that an aircraft intended to destroy its kind in the air needed at least to be fast enough to catch its quarry. Fortunately another type of military aircraft already existed, which was to form the basis for an effective "fighter" in the modern sense of the word. It was based on the small fast aircraft developed before the war for such air races as the Gordon Bennett and Schneider trophies. The military scout aeroplane was not initially expected to be able to carry serious armament, but to rely on its speed to be able to reach the location it was required to scout or reconnoitre and return quickly to report  all the time making a difficult target for AA artillery or enemy gun-carrying aircraft. British scout aircraft in this sense included the Sopwith Tabloid and Bristol Scout  French equivalents included the light, fast Morane-Saulnier N.

It was based on the small fast aircraft developed before the war for such air races as the Gordon Bennett and Schneider trophies. The military scout aeroplane was not initially expected to be able to carry serious armament, but to rely on its speed to be able to reach the location it was required to scout or reconnoitre and return quickly to report  all the time making a difficult target for AA artillery or enemy gun-carrying aircraft. British scout aircraft in this sense included the Sopwith Tabloid and Bristol Scout  French equivalents included the light, fast Morane-Saulnier N.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Ursprünglich verstand man unter dem Begriff Jäger ein Flugzeug mit zwei Mann Besatzung, dem Piloten und einem Bordschützen, der das Bordmaschinengewehr bediente. Die ersten Jäger dieser Art gehöhrte zu der 'Gunbus' Reihe der Vicker-Werke mit verschiedenen experimentellen Bewaffnungen, was 1914 zur Entwicklung des Vickers F.B.5 Gunbus führte. Der Hauptnachteil dieser Maschinen war die geringe Geschwindigkeit. Schnell wurde klar, dass ein Flugzeug, das in der Lage sein soll ein vergleichbares in der Luft zu zerstören, wenigstens schnell genug sein muß, seine Beute zu stellen. Zum Glück existierte bereits ein anderer Flugzeugtyp, der zur Basis eines effektiveren Jägers im heutigem Sinne wurde. Dabei handelte es sich um ein vor dem Krieg entworfenes kleines Flugzeug, ursprünglich für Luftrennen gedacht. Vom militärischen Aufklärungsflugzeug wurde ursprünglich nicht erwartet, ernsthafte Bewaffnung zu tragen, sondern es sollte aufgrund von Geschwindigkeit Aufklärungsarbeit leisten, während es ein schweres Ziel für Luftabwehr oder Flugzeuge darstellte. Brittische Aufklärungsflugzeuge waren zum Beispiel der Soqwith Tabloid und der Bristol Scout, französische verglkeichbare Aufkläreren waren zum Beispiel die leichten, schnellen Morane-Saulnier N.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Bombers evolved at the same time as the fighter aircraft at the start of World War I. The first use of an air-dropped bomb however, was carried out by the Italians in their 1911 war for Libya. In 1912 Bulgarian Air Force pilot Christo Toprakchiev suggested the use of airplanes to drop "bombs" (as grenades were called in the Bulgarian army at this time) on Turkish positions. Captain Simeon Petrov developed the idea and created several prototypes by adapting different types of grenades and increasing their payload.On October 16, 1912, observer Prodan Toprakchiev dropped two of those bombs on the Turkish railway station of Karaagac (near the besieged Edirne) from an Albatros F.II airplane piloted by Radul Milkov. This was the second use of an airplane as a bomber.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Bombers evolved at the same time as the fighter aircraft at the start of World War I. Captain Simeon Petrov developed the idea and created several prototypes by adapting different types of grenades and increasing their payload.On October 16, 1912, observer Prodan Toprakchiev dropped two of those bombs on the Turkish railway station of Karaagac (near the besieged Edirne) from an Albatros F.II airplane piloted by Radul Milkov. This was the second use of an airplane as a bomber.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Zu Beginn des ersten Weltkrieges entwickelten sich parallel zu den Jagdflugzeugen Bomber. Die erste richtige Luftbombardierung wurde 1911 von Italien durchgeführt im Krieg gegen Libyen. Etwas später 1912 schlug der bulgarische Pilot Christo Toprachiev den Einsatz von Flugzeugen, um Granaten auf türkische Stellungen abzuwerfen. Die Idee wurde von Hauptmann Simeon Petrov weiterentwickelt und führte zur Entwicklung einiger Prototypen, indem verschiedene Granattypen verändert und deren Sprengladung erhöht wurde. Am 16. Oktober 1912 beobachte Prodan Toprakchiev den Abwurf zweier dieser Bomben auf den türkischen Bahnhof Karaagac nahe dem belagten Edirne aus einem Albatros F.II Flugzeug. Das war der zweite Einsatz eines Flugzeugs als Bomber.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A tracked fighting vehicle was proposed in 1912 by Australian engineer L. E. de Mole. It was one of the earliest practical designs offered to the British War Office. He was notified in June 1913 that his idea had been rejected, though only some of his drawings were returned. He resisted urging from friends to sell the design to the German consul in Perth. The stalemate on the Western Front later prompted the British Army to begin research into a self-propelled vehicle which could cross trenches, crush barbed wire, and be impervious to machine-gun fire. Originally, tanks were part of the British Navy, which would train and provide all tank personnel, and were considered "landships". The First Lord of the Admiralty, Winston Churchill, sponsored the Landships Committee, which created the first successful prototype tank, 'Little Willie', in September 1915. The vehicles were colloquially referred to as water carriers, later shortened to tanks, to preserve secrecy; the name became official in December 1915. The first tank to engage in battle was D1, a British Mark I, during the Battle of Flers-Courcellette (part of the Battle of the Somme), on 15 September 1916, one of two to breach German lines and reach Flers, but was knocked out by friendly fire. One of these two also mistakenly machinegunned the 9th Norfolks, who were preparing to attack. The French developed the Schneider CA1 working from Holt caterpillar tractors, and first used it on 16 April 1917. The first successful use of massed tanks in combat occurred at Cambrai on 20 November 1917. Tanks were also used to great effect in the Battle of Amiens, when Allied forces were able to break through entrenched German position due to armoured support.

TEXT.German: [TAB]1912 entwarf der australische Ingenieur L. E. de Mole ein frühes Kampffahrzeug mit Ketten. Dies war einer der ersten praktisch umgesetzten Designs, die dem britischen Kriegsministerium angeboten wurden. Im Juni 1913 wurde dieses Design abgelehnt, allerdings nur ein Teil der Entwürfe zurückgegeben. Er widerstand dem Drängen von Freunden, dem deutschen Konsul in Perth das Design zu verkaufen. Die Pattsituation an der Westfront später brachte die britische Armee dazu, selbst Forschungen auf dem Gebiet motorisierter Kampffahrzeuge anzustellen, die nicht anfällig gegen Maschinengewehrfeuer sind und Hindernisse niederreißen können. Die ersten britischen Panzer wurden der Flotte unterstellt als "Landschiffe", wobei der erste Seelord, Winston Churchill, die Gruppe tatkräftig unterstützte, die an dem ersten erfolgreichen Prototypen arbeitete, dem 'Little Willie' aus dem September 1915. Umgangssprachlich wurden diese Maschinen zunächst als 'water carriers' (Wasserträger) bezeichnet, was zum englischen Ausdruck 'tank' führte, der Dezember 1915 offiziell wurde. Der D1, ein britischer 'Mark I', war der erste im Kampf eingesetzte Panzer, als an der Schlacht von Somme am 15. September 1916 teilnahm, um die deutschen Linien zu durchbrechen. Er wurde durch freundliches Feuer vernichtet.

TEXT.German: [TAB]1912 entwarf der australische Ingenieur L. E. de Mole ein frühes Kampffahrzeug mit Ketten. Dies war einer der ersten praktisch umgesetzten Designs, die dem britischen Kriegsministerium angeboten wurden. Im Juni 1913 wurde dieses Design abgelehnt, allerdings nur ein Teil der Entwürfe zurückgegeben. Er widerstand dem Drängen von Freunden, dem deutschen Konsul in Perth das Design zu verkaufen. Die Pattsituation an der Westfront später brachte die britische Armee dazu, selbst Forschungen auf dem Gebiet motorisierter Kampffahrzeuge anzustellen, die nicht anfällig gegen Maschinengewehrfeuer sind und Hindernisse niederreißen können. Die ersten britischen Panzer wurden der Flotte unterstellt als "Landschiffe", wobei der erste Seelord, Winston Churchill, die Gruppe tatkräftig unterstützte, die an dem ersten erfolgreichen Prototypen arbeitete, dem 'Little Willie' aus dem September 1915. Umgangssprachlich wurden diese Maschinen zunächst als 'water carriers' (Wasserträger) bezeichnet, was zum englischen Ausdruck 'tank' führte, der Dezember 1915 offiziell wurde. Der D1, ein britischer 'Mark I', war der erste im Kampf eingesetzte Panzer, als an der Schlacht von Somme am 15. September 1916 teilnahm, um die deutschen Linien zu durchbrechen. Er wurde durch freundliches Feuer vernichtet.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The first generation represents the first attempts at using turbojets for propulsion, providing greatly increased speed (the efficiency of piston-driven propellers drops off considerably at transsonic speeds). Many of these early jets resembled their piston-driven counterparts in several ways. Many were straight-winged aircraft armed primarily with cannon; radar was not yet in common usage except on specialized night fighters.

TEXT.German: [TAB]In der ersten Generation Düsenjäger wurde mit Turbojets als Antrieb experimentiert, die eine deutlich erhöhte Geschwindigkeit ermöglichten, da durch Propellermaschinen bei schallnaher Geschwindigkeit einen rapiden Leistungsabfall haben. Viele dieser frühen Düsenjäger glichen ihren propellerbetrieben Verwandten sehr, oft mit geraden Flügeln und hauptsächlich mit Geschützen ausgerüstet. Radar war zu dieser Zeit noch nicht verbreitet, wenn man von einigen sehr spezialisierten Nachtflugmaschinen absieht.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A self-propelled anti-tank gun, or tank destroyer, is a type of armoured fighting vehicle. Tank destroyers are used primarily to provide anti-tank support in combat operations but do not fit all the criteria of a tank. They may mount a high-velocity anti-tank gun but have an open turret, no turret at all or run on wheels instead of tracks. Vehicles which carry an anti-tank guided missile launcher are referred to as ATGM carriers. Tank destroyers cannot fulfil the many roles of tanks; they are much less flexible, and usually lack a strong anti-infantry capability. A common feature of a tank destroyer is the absence of a turret, and compared to tanks, an even stronger disposition for heavy frontal armor (compared to side and rear armor). However, as a result of having no turret and fewer parts, tank destroyers are much less expensive to manufacture. Gun-armed tank destroyers have been largely supplanted by the more general-purpose tanks since World War II, but lightly-armoured ATGM carriers are used for supplementary long-range antitank capabilities.

TEXT.German: [TAB]Panzerbrecher sind gepanzerte Kampffahrzeuge, die mit einer Panzer-Abwehr-Kanone (PAK) ausgerüstet sind. Für gewöhnlich werden Panzerbrecher gegen Panzer eingesetzt, erfüllen aber selbst nicht alle Kriterien um selbst als Panzer zu gelten. Auch wenn sie mit einer Hochgeschwindigkeits-PAK ausgerüstet sind, so verfügen sie über einen offenen Turm, wenn sie überhaupt einen haben, oder laufen oft auf Rädern. Fahrzeuge, die Anti-Panzer-Lenkraketen tragen, werden ATGM Träger abgekürzt. Panzerbrecher sind weniger flexibel als Panzer und nicht so stark gegen Infanterie. Nicht selten haben Panzerbrecher eine verstärkte Frontpanzerung verglichen mit Panzern, dafür aber keinen Turm, und sind dadurch kostengünstiger.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Arguably, the first Mechanized infantry were 36 two-man infantry squads carried forward by Mark V tanks at the Battle of Amiens in 1918. In a battle of such scale, their contribution went unnoticed. Towards the end of World War I, all the armies involved were faced with the problem of maintaining the momentum of an attack. Tanks, artillery or infiltration tactics could all be used to break through an enemy defense, but almost all the offensives launched in 1918 ground to a halt after a few days. Pursuing infantry quickly became exhausted, and artillery, supplies and fresh formations could not be brought forward over the battlefields quickly enough to maintain the pressure on the regrouping enemy. It was widely acknowledged that cavalry were too vulnerable to be used on most European battlefields, although many armies continued to deploy them. Motorised Infantry could maintain rapid movement, but their trucks required either a good road network, or firm open terrain (such as desert). They were unable to traverse a battlefield obstructed by craters, barbed wire and trenches. Tracked or all-wheel drive vehicles were to be the solution.

TEXT.German: [TAB]Die scheinbar erste Mechanisierte Infanterie waren 36 Zwei-Mann-Trupps, die 1918 bei der Schlacht um Amiens von Mark V Panzern befördert wurden. In einem derart großen Gefecht waren die Ergebnisse relativ unbedeutend. Gegen Ende des Ersten Weltkrieges hatten alle beteiligten Armeen das Problem den Schwung eines Angriffs aufrecht zu erhalten. Panzer, Artillerie und Infiltrationstaktiken ermöglichten, dass die feindlichen Linien durchbrochen werden konnten, aber 1918 verliefen sich fast alle Offensiven innerhalb weniger Tage. Die angreifenden Infanteristen waren schnell erschöpft und Artillerie und Nachschub konnten nicht schnell genug hinterher geschafft werden, um den Druck auf den sich neu gruppierenden Gegner aufrecht zu erhalten. Kavallerie war für den Einsatz auf den meisten europäischen Kriegsschauplätzen zu verwundbar, auch wenn viele Armeen sie weiterhin einsetzten. Motorisierte Infanterie war schnell, jedoch benötigten die LKWs ein gutes Straßennetz oder vollkommen offenes Gelände. Also lief es auf die Notwendigkeit hinaus eine Lösung mit Ketten- oder Allradfahrzeugen zu finden.

TEXT.English: [TAB]"Light" Modern Infantry has by the original NATO-classification often been units lacking heavy anti-armour capacity, only equipped with LAW, systems like M72 LAW and AT4. However, recent technological developments have somewhat blurred that scale. Today, the term "light" refers not to the lower amount of equipment (and hence weight) that light infantry have to carry, but to the fact that they have fewer and lighter organic assets, e.g. vehicles, mortars, artillery, and anti tank weapons compared to armoured infantry (who use armoured fighting vehicles). In fact because of the lack of organic transport, light infantry may well have to carry heavier loads than fully mechanised infantry. This lack of equipment means that they have less firepower but are much easier to deploy. Light infantry are used where it would not be possible, desirable or cost effective to deploy AFVs and have the advantage that they can be deployed around the world in days (instead of the weeks it would takes for a mechanized infantry units).

TEXT.German: [TAB]Nach ursprünglicher NATO-Bezeichnung ist 'Leichte' Infenterie eine Einheit ohne schwerer, maximal mit leichter panzerbrechende Bewaffnung. Moderne Technologien haben jedoch die Grenzen zwischen schweren und leichten panzerbrechenden Waffen verschwimmen lassen. Heutzutage wird der Begriff 'Leichte' Infanterie nicht mehr über die Ausrüstung definiert sondern über Hilfsfahrzeuge. Schwere Infanterie nutz schwere gepanzerte Kampffahrzeuge, während Leichte Infanterie für gewöhnlich tatsächlich zu Fuß unterwegs ist, und deswegen größere Mengen Munition, Versorgungsgüter und Ausrüstungen tragen muß. Dadurch hat Leichte Infanterie zwangläufig eine geringere Feuerkraft. Deswegen wird Leichte Infanterie überwiegend dort eingesetzt, wo Fahrzeuge nicht eingesetzt werden können oder zu viel Aufmerksamkeit erregen. Außerdem sind sie innerhalb deutlich kürzerer Zeit absetzbar und einsatzbereit.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Advanced Tactical Fighter (ATF) contract was a demonstration and validation program undertaken by the United States Air Force to develop a next-generation air superiority fighter to counter emerging worldwide threats, including development and proliferation of Soviet-era Su-27 'Flanker' type fighter aircraft. In 1981, USAF developed a requirement for a new air superiority fighter intended to replace the capability of the F-15 Eagle. It was envisaged that the ATF would incorporate emerging technologies including advanced alloys and composite material, advanced fly-by-wire flight control systems, higher power propulsion systems, and low-observable, or stealth technology. Following a hard-fought fly-off competition, in August 1991 the YF-22 was declared the winner and the Lockheed team was awarded the contract to develop and build the Advanced Tactical Fighter. The Northrop design was later considered by the company for modification as a bomber but such proposals have not come to fruition. The production version of the aircraft, the F-22 Raptor was unveiled on April 9, 1997, at Lockheed-Georgia Co., Marietta, Georgia, and conducted its first flight on September 7, 1997. The Raptor achieved initial operational capability on December 15, 2005.

TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Strategische Jäger (engl. Advanced Tactical Fight, ATF), wie er von den Amerikanern entwickelt wurde, ist konzepiert, um weltweit gegen Gefahren eingesetzt zu werden und Luftüberlegeheit erreichen zu können. Dabei muß er sich mit der russischen Su-27 'Flanker' messen. 1981 bestimmte die US Luftwaffe Richtlinien, die ein Nachfolger für die F-15 erfüllen muß. Diese beinhalteten unter anderem: Verbesserte Verbundstoffe und Aluminiumlegierungen, fortschrittliche Steuerungssysteme, höhere Schubleistung, verringerte Sichtbarkeit und Stealth-Technologie. In einem Kopf-an-Kopf-Rennen setzte sich im August 1991 die YF-22 durch und Lockhead bekam den Zuschlag für den ATF. Seit 1997 ist der F-22 'Raptor' im Dienst.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The second generation (of jet fighters, 1953-60) describes the integration of many new technologies to greatly improve the fighting capability of the jet fighter. The introduction of guided missiles such as the AIM-9 Sidewinder and AIM-7 Sparrow moved combat to beyond visual range (though it often devolved into dogfights in visual range), necessitating the standardization of radar to acquire targets. Designers experimented with a variety of aeronautical innovations, such as the swept wing, delta wing, variable-geometry wings, and area ruled fuselages. With the aid of swept wing, these were the first production aircraft to break the sound barrier. The third generation (1960-1970) is marked by maturity in the innovations introduced in the first generation. As this aeronautical development approached maturity, growth in combat capability grew via the introduction of improved missiles, radar, and other avionics. Most significantly, as a result of combat experience with guided missiles, designers conceded that combat could and would degenerate into close dogfights. Guns again became standard, and maneuverability was once again a priority.

Designers experimented with a variety of aeronautical innovations, such as the swept wing, delta wing, variable-geometry wings, and area ruled fuselages. With the aid of swept wing, these were the first production aircraft to break the sound barrier. The third generation (1960-1970) is marked by maturity in the innovations introduced in the first generation. As this aeronautical development approached maturity, growth in combat capability grew via the introduction of improved missiles, radar, and other avionics. Guns again became standard, and maneuverability was once again a priority.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Während der zweite Generation Düsenjäger (1953-60) wurden viele neue Technologien integriert, um die Kampffähigkeiten von Jägern zu verbessern. Die Einführung von Lenkraketen wie die AIM-9 Sidewinder oder die AIM-7 Sparrow ermöglichten Kampfhandlungen jenseits der Sichtweite (obwohl Nahkämpfe immernoch oft vorkamen), was standartisierte Radaranlagen zur Zielerfassung benötigte. Die Entwickler experimentierten mit verschiedenen Innovationen, rückwärts gepfeilte Flügel, Deltaflügel, Flügel mit variablen Geometrien und flächigen Rümpfen. Durch pfeilförmige Flüge wurden Flugzeuge möglich, die die Schallmauer durchbrechen konnten. Mit der dritten Generation (1960-70) wurden Merkmale der ersten beiden Generationen ausgepfeilt und Geschütze gehöhrten wieder zur Standardbewaffnung.

TEXT.English: [TAB]In military tactics, close air support (CAS) is defined as air action by fixed or rotary winged aircraft against hostile targets that are in close proximity to friendly forces, and which requires detailed integration of each air mission with fire and movement of these forces.
TEXT.French: [TAB]In military tactics, close air support (CAS) is defined as air action by fixed or rotary winged aircraft against hostile targets that are in close proximity to friendly forces, and which requires detailed integration of each air mission with fire and movement of these forces.
TEXT.German: [TAB]In der Militärtaktik wird Luftunterstützung (engl. close air support, CAS) als Lufteinsatz definiert, durch Maschinen mit starren oder rotierenden Flügeln, gegen feindliche Ziele, die nahe an den eigenen Truppen liegen, und welche enge Zusammenarbeit mit den Bodentruppen erfordern.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Historically, the Cruiser's main role was to attack enemy merchant vessels, so much so that this task came to be called cruiser warfare. Other roles included reconnaissance, and cruisers were often attached to the battlefleet. In the later 20th century, the decline of the battleship left the cruiser as the largest and most powerful surface combatant.

Other roles included reconnaissance, and cruisers were often attached to the battlefleet. In the later 20th century, the decline of the battleship left the cruiser as the largest and most powerful surface combatant.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Geschichtlich gesehen wurden Kreuzer überwiegend zum Abfangen von Handelsschiffen eingesetzt, in einem Grad, dass 'Kreuzer Kriegsführung' ein geläufiger Ausdruck dafür wurde. Nebenbei wurden Kreuzer zur Aufklärung oder in Flottenverbänden eingesetzt. Im späten 20. Jahrhundert wurde der Kreuzer durch den Rückgang der Schlachtschiffe zu der größten und stärksten Überwasser-Schiffsklasse.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The M998 High Mobility Multipurpose Wheeled Vehicle (HMMWV or Humvee) is a military 4WD motor vehicle created by AM General. It has largely supplanted the roles formerly served by the M151 1/4 ton MUTT, the M561 "Gama Goat", their M718A1 and M792 ambulance versions, the CUCV, and other light trucks with the United States military, as well as being used by a number of other countries and organizations. Humvees were originally also referred to as Hummers, though that term was later reserved for a civilian SUV based on the Humvee.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A helicopter is an aircraft that is lifted and propelled by one or more horizontal rotors, each rotor consisting of two or more rotor blades. Helicopters are classified as rotorcraft or rotary-wing aircraft to distinguish them from fixed-wing aircraft because the helicopter derives its source of lift from the rotor blades rotating around a mast. The word 'helicopter' is adapted from the French hélicoptere, coined by Gustave de Ponton d'Amecourt in 1861. It is linked to the Greek words helix/helik- = "spiral" or "turning" and pteron = "wing".

The word 'helicopter' is adapted from the French hélicoptere, coined by Gustave de Ponton d'Amecourt in 1861. It is linked to the Greek words helix/helik- = "spiral" or "turning" and pteron = "wing".
TEXT.German: [TAB]Helikopter sind Flugmaschinen die durch einen oderer mehrere horizontale Rotoren Auf- und Antrieb erhalten, wobei jeder Rotor aus zwei oder mehr Rotorblättern besteht. Die um einen Mast rotierenden Rotorblätter erzeugen etwas ähnliches wie ein Luftkissen, auf dem der Helikopter schwebt, und basiert somit auf einer völlig anderen Flugmechanik als ein Flugzeug.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Galleass is a large, fast, heavily armed three-masted Mediterranean galley with a forecastle and aftcastle from the 16th and 17th centuries. As converted for military use they were higher and larger than regular ("light") galleys. They had as many as thirty-two oars, each worked by up to 5 men. Much effort was made in Venice to make these galleasses as fast as they could be so they could compete with regular galleys. The gun-deck usually ran over the rowers' heads, although pictures showing the opposite arrangement exist. Galleasses usually carried more sails than true galleys, and were far deadlier; a galley caught broadside lay all but helpless, but coming broadside to a galleass, as with a ship of the line, merely exposed an attacker to her gunfire. The galleass exemplified an intermediate type between the galley and the true man-of-war. Relatively few galleasses were built, one disadvantage was that, being more reliant on sails, their position at the front of the galley line at the start of a battle could not be guaranteed, but they featured at the Battle of Lepanto (7 October 1571), their firepower helping to win victory for the Christian fleet, and some sufficiently seaworthy galleasses accompanied the Spanish Armada in 1588 (e.g. La Girona). In the Mediterranean, with its shallower waters, less dangerous weather and fickle winds, galleasses and galleys alike continued in use, particularly in Venice and Turkey, long after they became regarded as obsolete elsewhere. Later, "round ships" and galleasses were replaced by galleons and ships of the line which originated in northern Europe.

TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Galleasse ist eine große, schnelle und schwer bewaffnete mediterrane Galeere mit drei Masten und je einem schweren Kastell an Bug und Heck, das im 16. und 17. Jahrhundert eingesetzt wurde. Speziell für den militärischen Einsatz gerüstet, waren sie deutlich größer als reguläre Geleeren. Sie war mit um die 32 Ruder ausgerüstet, jedes von 5 Mann gerudert. Die Kanonendecks befanden sich über oder unter den Ruderern. Die Galeassen waren ein Zwischending zwischen Geleeren und späteren schweren Fregatten. Relativ wenige dieser Schiffe wurden gebaut und nach Einsatz in der Spanischen Armada lief der Schiffstyp zusehens aus.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Mikoyan Project 1.44/1.42 is a 5th generation jet technology demonstrator developed by the Mikoyan Design Bureau. Apart from a number of names along the lines of "Object/Project 1.44/1.42", the aircraft is also known as the MiG-MFI. MiG is now using this designation for an advanced Mikoyan MiG-29. Despite the non-production status of the 1.44/1.42, NATO has assigned the reporting name "Flatpack" to this aircraft.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The tank's hull was 10.1 metres long, 3.67 metres wide and 3.66 metres tall. Weighing about 180 tonnes (or about 188 short tons), the Maus's main armament was a 128 mm cannon with a coaxial 75 mm gun and steel armour ranging from 60-240 mm. A total of nine were in various stages of completion when the war ended with two completed. The Maus would have had a crew of either 5 or 6 and a total production of between 150 and 200 was planned for one version of it.[TAB]The principal problem in development of the Maus was finding a powerful enough engine for its weight that could be carried in the tank.
TEXT.French: [TAB]The tank's hull was 10.1 metres long, 3.67 metres wide and 3.66 metres tall. Weighing about 180 tonnes (or about 188 short tons), the Maus's main armament was a 128 mm cannon with a coaxial 75 mm gun and steel armour ranging from 60-240 mm. A total of nine were in various stages of completion when the war ended with two completed. The Maus would have had a crew of either 5 or 6 and a total production of between 150 and 200 was planned for one version of it.[TAB]The principal problem in development of the Maus was finding a powerful enough engine for its weight that could be carried in the tank.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Dieser Panzer war 10,1 Meter lang, 3,67 Meter breit und 3,66 Meter hoch mit einem Gewicht um die 180 Tonnen. Die überwiegende Bewaffnung des Maus Panzers bestand aus einer 128 mm Kanone, einem koaxialem 75 mm Geschütz und einer Panzerung zwischen 60 und 240 mm. Insgesamt neun diese Fahrzeuge waren in verschiedenen Stadien der Fertigstellung als der Krieg endete, nur zwei waren Einsatzbereit. Die Besatzung der Maus war mit 5 oder 6 Mann geplannt, bei einer geplannten Stückzahl von 150 bis 200 in der ersten Version. Problem bei der Entwicklung war es, einen ausreichend starken Motor zu finden.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Panzerkampfwagen VIII Maus (Sd.Kfz 205)[COLOR_REVERT] was a German super-heavy tank design, and the heaviest tank to reach the complete working prototype stage in World War II. The basic design was known as the VK7001/Porsche Type 205.

TEXT.English: [TAB]In April 1917, the Royal Naval Air Service (RNAS) introduced the Sopwith Triplane. The Sopwith swiftly proved itself superior to the Albatros and Halberstadt scouts then in use by the German Air Service. In response, the Idflieg immediately solicited designs for new triplane scouts. No fewer than 11 German aircraft manufacturers, including Albatros, Pfalz, AEG, DFW, Schütte-Lanz, and Euler, responded with triplane prototypes. Most showed little promise, though limited production of the Pfalz Dr. I was undertaken.The Fokker works responded with the V.3, a small, rotary-powered triplane with a tubular-steel frame fuselage and thick cantilever wings. Initial tests revealed deficiencies in the V.3, particularly regarding control forces. Instead of submitting the V.3 for a type test, Fokker produced a revised prototype designated V.4. The most notable changes were the introduction of horn-balanced ailerons and elevators, as well as longer-span wings. The V.4 also featured interplane struts, which were not necessary from a structural standpoint, but which minimized wing flexing.The V.4 proved superior to the triplane prototypes submitted by the other manufacturers. After a type test, Idflieg issued an immediate production order.

After a type test, Idflieg issued an immediate production order.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Als die Briten im April 1917 den Soqith Dreidecker einführten, zeigte sich dieser deutschen Maschinen als überlegen. Nicht weniger als 11 deutsche Firmen arbeiteten daraufhin emsig an einem neuen Dreideckerentwurf, der es mit der Soqwith aufnehmen konnte, darunter Albatros, Pfalz, AEG, DFW, Schütte-Lanz und Euler. Allerdings enttäuschten viele dieser Entwürfe. Die Fokker-Werke versuchten es mit der V.3, der Steuerungsprobleme aufwies. Erst die überarbeitete Version V.4 setzte zeigte sich seinen Konkurenten gegenüber überlegen, woraufhin ein Bauauftrag an die Fokker-Werke ging.

TEXT.Hungarian: [TAB]In April 1917, the Royal Naval Air Service (RNAS) introduced the Sopwith Triplane. The Sopwith swiftly proved itself superior to the Albatros and Halberstadt scouts then in use by the German Air Service. In response, the Idflieg immediately solicited designs for new triplane scouts. No fewer than 11 German aircraft manufacturers, including Albatros, Pfalz, AEG, DFW, Schütte-Lanz, and Euler, responded with triplane prototypes. Most showed little promise, though limited production of the Pfalz Dr. I was undertaken.The Fokker works responded with the V.3, a small, rotary-powered triplane with a tubular-steel frame fuselage and thick cantilever wings. Initial tests revealed deficiencies in the V.3, particularly regarding control forces. Instead of submitting the V.3 for a type test, Fokker produced a revised prototype designated V.4. The most notable changes were the introduction of horn-balanced ailerons and elevators, as well as longer-span wings. The V.4 also featured interplane struts, which were not necessary from a structural standpoint, but which minimized wing flexing.The V.4 proved superior to the triplane prototypes submitted by the other manufacturers. After a type test, Idflieg issued an immediate production order.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fokker Dr. I Dreidecker[COLOR_REVERT] (triplane) was a World War I fighter aircraft designed by Reinhold Platz and built by Fokker-Flugzeugwerke. The Dr.I saw widespread service in the spring of 1918. It became renowned as the aircraft in which Manfred von Richthofen gained his last 20 victories, and in which he was killed on 21 April 1918.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Light bomber is a relatively small and fast class of military bomber aircraft which was employed mainly before the 1950s. Such aircraft would probably not carry more than one ton of ordnance. Some of them were dive bombers. Light bombers were also the only type of bombers operating from aircraft carriers. Some twin-engine light bomber designs were also successful when converted into heavy fighters or nightfighters. eg Bristol Blenheim.The light bomber was tasked with missions similar to that of modern attack aircraft and fighter-bombers.

TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Leichte Bomber ist ein relativ kleiner und schneller Militärbomber, der überwiegend vor den 1950ern eingesetzt wurde. Solche Maschinen trugen nicht mehr als eine Tonne Bombenlast. Einige davon waren Sturzkampfbomber. Leichte Bomber sind ebenso der einzige Bombertyp, der vom einem Flugzeugträger aus operieren kann. Einige zweimotorige Leichte Bomber wurden später erfolgreich in schwere Jäger umgebaut oder für Nachtflüge umgerüstet, wie der Bristol Blenheim.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Military [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Transport Helicopters[COLOR_REVERT] are used in places where the use of conventional aircraft is impossible. For example the military transport helicopter is the primary transport asset of US Marines deploying from LHDs and LHA. The landing possibilities of helicopter are almost unlimited, and where landing is impossible, for example densely packed jungle, the ability of the helicopter to hover allows troops to deploy by abseiling and roping. Transport helicopters are operated in assault, medium and heavy classes. Air assault helicopters are usually the smallest of the transport types, and designed to move an infantry section and their equipment. Helicopters in the assault role are generally armed for self protection both in transit and for suppression of the landing zone. This armament may be in the form of door gunners, or the modification of the helicopter with stub wings and pylons for the carriage of missiles and rocket pods. For example the Sikorsky S-70 fitted with the ESSM (External Stores Support System) and the Hip E variant of the Mil Mi-8 can carry as much disposable armament as some dedicated attack helicopters. The assault helicopter can be thought of as the modern successor to the military glider.

Die um einen Mast rotierenden Rotorblätter erzeugen etwas ähnliches wie ein Luftkissen, auf dem der Helikopter schwebt, und basiert somit auf einer völlig anderen Flugmechanik als ein Flugzeug.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Special forces (SF) and special operations forces (SOF) are generic terms for highly-trained military teams/units that conduct specialized operations such as reconnaissance, unconventional warfare, direct action and counter-terrorism actions. In the United States, the term special operations forces (SOF) is used instead of special forces as special forces refers to a specific unit, the United States Army Special Forces, commonly called the "Green Berets".
TEXT.French: [TAB]Special forces (SF) and special operations forces (SOF) are generic terms for highly-trained military teams/units that conduct specialized operations such as reconnaissance, unconventional warfare, direct action and counter-terrorism actions. In the United States, the term special operations forces (SOF) is used instead of special forces as special forces refers to a specific unit, the United States Army Special Forces, commonly called the "Green Berets".
TEXT.German: [TAB]Eine Spezialeinheit stellt eine geschlossene Einheit eines militärischen, polizeilichen oder nachrichtendienstlichen Verbandes dar, die in der Lage ist, aufgrund besonderer Ausbildung und speziellen Trainings Aufträge mit erhöhter Gefährdungslage wahrzunehmen. Ebenso decken sie besondere Einsatzspektren ab, die beispielsweise von konventionellem Militär nicht geleistet werden können. Spezialeinheiten verfügen in der Regel über eine weitergehende Ausbildung und häufig auch modernere Ausrüstung als konventionelle Einheiten.
